'''Love''' represents a number of human [[emotion]]s and experiences related to the senses of [[affection]] and sexual attraction.<ref name="oxford">''Oxford Illustrated American Dictionary'' (1998) + ''Merriam-Webster Collegiate Dictionary'' (2000).</ref> The word love can refer to a variety of different feelings, states, and attitudes, ranging from generic [[pleasure]] to intense [[interpersonal attraction]]. This diversity of meanings, combined with the complexity of the feelings involved, makes love unusually difficult to consistently define, even compared to other emotional states.
+
'''Love''' represents a range of human [[emotion]]s and experiences related to the senses of [[affection]] and sexual attraction.<ref name="oxford">''Oxford Illustrated American Dictionary'' (1998) + ''Merriam-Webster Collegiate Dictionary'' (2000).</ref> The word love can refer to a variety of different feelings, states, and attitudes, ranging from generic [[pleasure]] to intense [[interpersonal attraction]]. This diversity of meanings, combined with the complexity of the feelings involved, makes love unusually difficult to consistently define, even compared to other emotional states.
     
As an abstract concept ''love'' usually refers to a strong, [[ineffability|ineffable]] feeling towards for another person. Even this limited conception of love, however, encompasses a wealth of different feelings, from the passionate desire and intimacy of [[romance (love)|romantic love]] to the nonsexual. Love in its various forms acts as a major facilitator of [[interpersonal relationship]]s and, owing to its central psychological importance, is one of the most common themes in the [[creative arts]].
 
As an abstract concept ''love'' usually refers to a strong, [[ineffability|ineffable]] feeling towards for another person. Even this limited conception of love, however, encompasses a wealth of different feelings, from the passionate desire and intimacy of [[romance (love)|romantic love]] to the nonsexual. Love in its various forms acts as a major facilitator of [[interpersonal relationship]]s and, owing to its central psychological importance, is one of the most common themes in the [[creative arts]].
